revised_title: The Existence of Potassium Hyposulphite in Fired Gunpowder Residues
tldr: The authors investigate the existence of potassium hyposulphite in the solid residue of fired gunpowder and find that its presence is consequent upon slight variations during the explosion process. They also discuss the method used to determine the proportions of potassium monosulphide and hyposulphite in a powder residue.
